review: The Fire stick is easy to install and use, however if you have limits on  data usage it can present a problem. If the Fire Stick is on and the TV is on, then it is  using internet, even if you are watching a DVD. It needs an off switch, instead of unplugging it.
author: Donnie W Jolley

review: When I bought the stick I did not have very high expectations since there is a more expensive alternative. However, this stick provides what it claims. It is great for someone that uses Amazon Cloud for music and photos, who is a member of Amazon Prime, and Netflix. Everything is located in the same spot, which makes it very convenient. The device works really well even though it is wireless--I have not experienced any loss of high resolution or speed when watching movies. Every so often you need to reset it, but it is not a very big deal.Even though the device is listed as not supporting surround sound IT DOES! I love the quality of the sound for playing music and watching movies. I love that it shows the lyrics to the songs.My only negatives are that(1) the stick is that for some reason all movies show up really dark on the TV screen. If I change my TV settings to compensate, it is too bright when I switch to cable. It would be nice if it had some way of controlling the brightness and contrast.(2) even though you have your Amazon cloud music and Prime music available, you cannot modify or create playlists or select specific Prime radios to listen to. If there is a way, I have not figured it out.

review: I'm disappointed with this device. I bought two of them when they became available to Prime customers at a big discount. I kept one and gave one to my son at college. I do love the ability to connect my Amazon music into my home theatre and seeing the lyrics on screen for some songs made the Christmas season more fun for the family. However not all features work as designed. For example, the voice recognition in the Android app is not very good. I work with Nuance voice recognition products in my job, so I'm very familiar with how the voice reco should work. Bottom line, it just doesn't work as well as it should. Voice recognition is spotty at best. Plus, connecting the Fire Stick to your tablet or phone to control You Tube is extremely kludgey. There is a consistent disconnect between what is on your device and what your TV recognizes via the Fire Stick. The device almost always loses sync with the TV and you can't control what you're seeing on TV like you should be able to do. This is unfortunate because  I love Amazon and I am a committed customer, but I'm just not convinced that this device is their best offering. I also own a Chromecast and a Roku, so I'm very familiar with how these things should work. The Chromecast is still the better product and is easier to use. Sorry, but I would not recommend another purchase of this generation of Fire Stick.

review: Amazon Fire TV Stick is a great idea, but I have seen performance issues right from the start.  I’m very tech savvy and I have other similar products to do side by side real time comparisons.  I have compared this to my Panasonic streaming media player and watching videos on my computer.In every case my experience with Amazon Fire TV was poor to fair.  Setup crashed my router multiple times.  I never determined why, but each time I entered the router password and selected to continue all other devices connected to the router lost internet connection.  I am a professional computer network engineer.  I have multiple wireless routers.  Only the router I connected to the fire stick was effected and only for a few minutes just after I attempted to register and failed.  Then my router would reset and work properly with no further efforts.It took more than 10 attempts and 4 hours using the same procedure and password to get it set up for the first time.  I would guess 20+, but after 10+ I stopped counting.  Mostly it failed to connect to the network, but it also failed at parental controls and the home page a couple of times during setup.  Then there is no way to bypass the first use video.  It is not a bad video, but after 4 hours it seems like my time has been stolen.Overall, the time I wasted learning that this is a challenge to use cost me many times the price of the device.  If it worked, I could travel with this and not bring a computer or HDMI cable, but since it is so unreliable and hard to set up, it is likely to end up on a shelf then in the trash.  It is a shame, the idea is great.
